content: batlady  2015 rebecca averill this crocheted top pattern was inspired by the gorgeous knit pattern lady bat features bateau neck dolman sleeves chevron lace stitch composed of single_crochet row alternated with double_crochet mesh row worked top-down in one piece skill level intermediate materials & supplies 1200-1300 yards of fingering weight yarn of your choice size e hook or to attain gauge sizing & gauge size given is s-m sweater is oversized and easily customizable see schematic on last page approx 2 ½ per patt repeat lightly blocked stitch definitions fsc = foundation through all loops on hook you are makinga decrease with 3 st skipped between the 2 double_crochet notes on stitch pattern one pattern repetition patt repeat = 16 st see below for single_crochet rounds/row starting chain does not count as st for mesh rounds/row starting chain 3 does count as double_crochet starting chain 4 counts as double_crochet plus chain 1 notes on sweater construction sweater is worked top down in one piece front and back are identical front is worked across in st patt then garment is rotated and back is worked across in st patt top is worked in the round to cuffs then back and forth for the cuffs then joined and worked in the round to the hem increases take place along the shoulder/upper sleeve decreases take place along the underarm directions top portion of sweater to begin we will make two starting chains long and short the long chain will form one neck edge and two small wings that begin the shoulders the short chain will be attached during the first
